news_header: Baseball fans gather in Los Angeles for the Dodgers' World Series victory, largely due to star player Shohei Ohtani, whose impact is felt globally.
news_text: In Little Tokyo, Los Angeles, baseball fans from around the world celebrated the Dodgers' World Series win over the Yankees, largely influenced by star player Shohei Ohtani. His presence has drawn international attention, with fans participating in local traditions like sake shots for home runs. The Dodgers' victory, despite Ohtani not hitting any home runs in the series, has boosted local businesses and tourism, particularly from Japan. The 'Ohtani effect' is credited with increasing visitor numbers and enhancing the local economy, as fans embrace the multicultural spirit of the event.
